answers.answer: Hi...many with reflux or GERD have hunger pangs as a result of this condition...we know we r not hungry, but feel that pang.I found munching on dry crackers or fresh fruit can help....u also have to get ur acids balanced....do see a GI dr and avoid foods that will cause  urs to flare.See the Health Pages for tips on foods that r safe and foods to avoid..as well as tips on lifestyle modification that may also help.http://www.medhelp.org/health_pages/list?cid=236"selma"

question: I am a 20 year old female 5'7" tall, 200 pounds (I'm pretty overweight). I dont know if its because I have a large stomach that can hold a lot or if I have some kind of disorder, but for the longest time when I get hungry I'm instantly starving. and if I dont eat right away, the hunger pain gets worse and its like an acidic burning thats unbearable. I start to shake and feel sick. it even happens within a couple hours after I eat. its gotten so bad that I am actually afraid of leaving my house without bringing food with me. do I have acid reflux? or some kind of diabetes? I try not to over eat but the pain forces me to stuff my face when I know I shouldn't be hungry. I cant afford to see a doctor, can someone please help me?
title: excruciating hunger pains when i shouldnt be hungry.
